description: From the warm 2019 vintage, this is a soft and fruity wine. It's open with broad white fruit flavors, the acidity lighter than usual for Chablis, giving it a particularly ripe character. Drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2021  Chablis

description: This soft, rounded wine is ripe with generous pear and melon flavors. It's easy and ready to drink young for its smooth, attractively ripe character.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2021  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: The impact of 50-year old vines is seen in the concentrated fruit, ripe and full,  in this wine. The flavors are of fresh apricots, edged with green apples and pink grapefruit, a combination that shows both richness and great freshness. The finish is a reminder of the fine acidity in 2010.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Les Vénérables Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: A citrus-dominated wine, lime and lemon giving a crisp intensity. There is a somewhat bitter toast element, but the acidity, the fresh fruits and the soft structure act as a counter-balance. Give it six months to a year. Screwcap.
title: Bertrand Ambroise 2012  St.-Romain

description: Rich and full in the mouth, packed with red fruits and black cherries. The wine is sweet, while keeping a tannic core. Drink next year.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015 Les Dames Huguettes  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: This beautiful, rich wine has yellow fruits and is concentrated, tightly textured and conveys a ripe character. The touches of wood are just right, adding spice to the opulent fruitiness. A mineral texture gives some tightness to the aftertaste. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Le Montrachet  (Montrachet)

description: Produced from vines more than 100 years old in the heart of the Clos de Vougeot vineyard, this is an impressive wine with a long future. The wood aging is already surrounded by ripe, intense black fruits. A fresher character comes from the bright acidity of the vintage, giving the wine a lift. The aftertaste is long and concentrated. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de la Tour 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: Up the slope above the Grand Cru of Le Montrachet, this vineyard once grew hemp (hence the name, cheneve). This poised wine is both stylish and rich, with good acidity allied to ripe apple and citrus fruits, cut through the mineral texture and promise a generous wine as it ages. Drink from 2024.
title: Philippe Colin 2020 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is an opulent wine from one of the fabled series of white Grand Crus. Along with generous yellow fruits and ripe citrus, it has weight and gravitas. Spice from the wood fills things out even more, giving the wine its balance, its intensity and its future. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2020  Criots-Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This big, ripe and fruity wine shows both the richness and the structure of the vintage, but never loses sight of balance. It's full of rich yellow fruits, green plums and citrus, but structured with refreshing acidity, a minerally texture and gentle hints of wood aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Rich and opulent, this is a full-throated Pinot Noir. It has ripe berry flavors and a balancing acidity that supports a dense texture and underlay of firm tannins. While delicious now, this is a wine that will improve with aging so drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Les Chatelots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This wine is ripe, rich and full in the mouth, like a fruit salad of red cherries, plums and berries. Yet there's a more solid side—rounded tannins support the concentrated fruits, and touches of wood aging broaden the feel of this impressive wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Les Feusselottes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: From a walled vineyard once owned by the local bishop, this wine is structured and firm while also having great red cherry and berry fruit. It's one of a number of Premier Crus from this producer—and certainly the most expressive with its generous fruit and balanced tannins. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2020 Le Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This soft wine has a gentle texture and smooth white fruits. It is fruity and lightly perfumed. With its crisp edge of acidity, is totally ready to drink.
title: Cave de Viré 2021 Grande Réserve du Président  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a soft and jammy wine with attractive ripe strawberry fruit and only the lightest structure. It is gentle, rounded and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2020 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This wine is extracted and tough. The acidity does come through to help out, although it still has a hard edge with some bitter toast. It will soften, leaving some perfumed fruit for the future.
title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2020  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: This light and fruity wine offers soft tannins and an earthy character. The wine comes mainly from Beaujolais with 15% of Pinot Noir from the Mâcon region. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2020  Coteaux Bourguignons

description: This wine has acidity and a good balance between the fresh, crisp character and the richer yellow fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Paul Reitz 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This is a blend from most parts of the village, with fruit from 14 different parcels. It is solid and firm while also having great swathes of raspberries and red plums laced together with acidity. The aftertaste is perfumed with a fresh lift. Drink from 2022
title: Domaine Faiveley 2020  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Young vines, planted in 2011, give a fresh, fruity wine with attractive citrus and zingy orange flavors. It is ripe and deliciously perfumed with a touch of minerality and saltiness. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2020 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Packed with red fruits and crisp acidity, this lively wine has a tight mousse, while the red-currant fruitiness adds intense acidity. The wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV La Burgondie Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This tangy wine has attractive acidity and a tightly coiled mineral texture. Apple and lemon flavors shoot right through the bright, crisp texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Buxy 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the northern part of the appellation, this ripe wine conveys peaches and apricots laced with lime. A vibrant, mineral wine with swathes of fresh acidity, it can be drunk now.
title: Château de Fuissé 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This rich wine is full and has a good balance of acidity and fruit. The lightly mineral texture gives bite and crispness. It is still a young, tight wine needing another few months. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Santenay 2020  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Spicy, fruity and attractive, this balanced wine has acidity, tight minerality, yellow fruits and a richer texture. Full bodied and generous, it will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fresh, crisp and fruity, this is an immediately drinkable wine. It has great freshness, lively acidity and perfumed apple fruitiness. The acidity cuts through brightly and leaves a vibrant, textured aftertaste.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Crisp and packed with lively lemon-like acidity, this wine shows both minerality and intense fruitiness. Textured and tight, it has hints of yellow fruit in the background that will blossom as the wine develops. Drink from 2021.
title: Alex Gambal 2020 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: From one of the highest premier cru vineyards comes a wine that has a cool edge, generous fruit and firm tannins. Those elements come together with black cherry flavors and a dry core, promising a serious future. Drink from 2023.
title: David Duband 2020 Aux Thorey Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine manages to combine firm structure with the finely perfumed fruit associated with Chambolle-Musigny. It's rich, fruity, lifted by acidity and held together by solid tannins. Impressive and full bodied, it's a wine to age. Drink from 2024.
title: David Duband 2020 Les Sentiers Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This dense and structured wine comes from a small walled vineyard within the larger Les Vignes Franches premier cru, partially owned by Louis Jadot. Robust tannins frame its rich, juicy black fruit, showing potential for long aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2020 Clos des Ursules Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This wine comes from a vineyard owned by the Gagey situated in the northern part of Nuits-Saint-Georges, close to Vosne-Romanée. It has firm structure and a perfumed character that is already enticing. Richly fruity with juicy acidity, it will be impressive as it ages. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2020 Les Boudots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: From old vines, at least 50 years old, this shows good concentration, giving a dense, ripe, rounded wine full of green apple fruits, hints of vanilla and streaks of minerality.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Les Vénérables  (Chablis)

description: This is a cool cru, which shows even in this great year with its structure, austerity and steely character. It makes it old-style Chablis, with its green fruits and lively, poised freshness.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With touches of vanilla and caramel as well as ripe yellow fruits, this is a warm, generous Chardonnay. It has freshness from the citrus edge and a soft texture. Straightforward, it is an open and ready-to-drink wine.
title: Louis Jadot 2018  Mâcon-Villages

description: At this stage, the wine is all dark structure and very firm. It will need time to develop its full potential as an intensely rich wine. Concentrated and firm, it is powered by tannins as well as sweet red fruits. So age for five years at least.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: While the aromas of this young wine reveal considerable toast, on the palate the wine brings forward the ripe apricot and mango flavors to go with that wood. As it matures, these elements will coalesce with the taut, tense mineral texture into an superb, ageworthy terroir-driven wine.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2015 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This rich wine balances ripe yellow fruits with intense citrus acidity in a harmonious whole. Its structure is laden with minerality, toast and a smooth, delicious creamy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2015 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Full-bodied wine with ripe pear and red apple flavors, laced with delicate acidity. It's an elegant wine, a fine balance with a more mineral, tight texture as a counterpoint. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2017 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: A smooth and rounded wine, its ripe plum and blueberry flavors well integrated into the soft tannins and sweet acidity. Drinkable now, but worth waiting for two more years.
title: Domaines Devillard 2017 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: Very dark, structured wine, with coffee as well as fruit flavors. The wood comes through firmly producing a solid, very dry character. The more juicy black currant fruits are still to show well. So wait to drink until 2019.
designation: Domaine de la Ferté Premier Cru Servoisine
title: Domaines Devillard 2017 Domaine de la Ferté Premier Cru Servoisine  (Givry)

description: This wine is fresh, perfumed with a juicy red-fruit character. It offers red cherries, with a soft texture and acidity. The great fruitiness leads to a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Givry is one of the unsung values in Burgundy. This ripe and structured wine shows why. It has weight, a firm texture and red plum and strawberry fruit flavors. All these elements are held together by a dark sense of tannin and fine acidity.
title: Antonin Rodet 2016  Givry

description: In this case, Vieilles Vignes (old vines) only means vines over 20 years. The wine is soft, rounded and full of red cherry fruitiness. Judicious wood aging has rounded the wine out while leaving all its fruit intact. It can be drunk now, but will be better from 2020.
title: Manuel Olivier 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This light-colored wine has a spicy character that points up the tannins as well as the red berry fruits. It has a light feeling, with refreshing acidity that shows strongly at the end. It's ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2018 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)

description: One of the lesser-known of the many Mâcon appellations, Péronne is close to Clessé. The wine is smooth, ripe and fruity, with a creamed pear and lightly lemon flavor. With a hint of minerality, it could age until 2020.
title: Jaffelin 2019 Les Villages de Jaffelin  (Mâcon-Péronne)

description: In a piece of French wine shorthand, the new appellation of Saint-Bris takes in the old Sauvignon de Saint-Bris wines. The style, though, hasn't changed: an attractive, if rustic type, with crisp gooseberry and grapefruit flavors and a fresh burst of acidity. Screwcap.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2013 Sauvignon de Saint-Bris  (Saint-Bris)

description: A ripe, crisp, very fresh Chablis bursting with green fruits, with a light layer of caramel and green herbs. Delicious now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Chablis

description: Structured, concentrated, a wine that shows power from both fruit and tannins. The opulent strawberry flavors are paralleled by firm, dry tannins. As the combination comes together, this will become a glorious wine.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Charmes-Chambertin

description: Big, full-bodied wine, the great tannins dominating the underlying red fruit. It's firmly concentrated, intense, a powerhouse of dense texture and obviously a wine that will need aging. Give it 5–6 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014  Charmes-Chambertin

description: Very dense wine, its tannins solid and concentrated. The structure is the leader here, with the young fruit showing through as black plum skins and crushed strawberries. This is a firmly tannic wine, needing aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: Beautiful lemon-scented wine, balancing rich butter and apricot flavors with intense, pure acidity. The wine at this stage is toast and fruit, still coalescing into its long-term future.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2014 Clavoillon Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: The aromas of smoky new wood follow through to the wood flavors on the palate. However, it's the powerful sweet black cherry and red berry fruit flavors, layered with fruit tannins and acidity, that are driving this impressive wine. For aging at least six years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Typical Beaune in its round, soft character. If the tannins are not particularly powerful, it still shows a generous nature, with super-ripe fruits supported by some dryness. The finish is jammy, ripe, a salad of red berries.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This wine is missing great depth of flavor. It has bright acidity and hints of peach fruit flavors, but remains dull.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a generous, rounded and very perfumed wine. Candy and bubble gum flavors give sweetness that contrasts with the acidity.
title: Demessey 2018 Château de Messey Les Crets  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: The wine is tight, green and herbal. It has some fruitiness, but that is suppressed by general underripeness. The tannins are hard at the end.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2017  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: This tight wine has red fruit acidity without the richness. With its green edge, it's likely to remain full of acidity even as it matures.
title: Pierre André 2017  Ladoix

description: A firm wine that is mainly tannin without a great fruit element. It is dry, tight and hard-edged.
title: Demessey 2017 Les Hâtes  (Santenay)

description: Tropical in character, this wine has soft acidity and an attractive texture. With ripe mango flavor, it's full in the mouth and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Marie Challand 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Tight, acidic and very crisp, it's propelled forward by lemon zest and grapefruit flavors. It is bright, fruity and light in texture.
title: Pierre André 2018  Saint-Véran

description: This soft, open wine has a light fruit character with attractive acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marie Challand 2018 Les Tilles  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Soft and full-bodied, this offers bright apple and citrus fruits layered with toast from wood aging. Under the broad exterior, the wine is developing more tangy, zesty fruits and a tight texture. It needs to age to bring everything together. Drink from 2021.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is an austere wine, packed with tannins and tight acidity. The red fruits are right at the back behind the firm structure. A mineral character supports the dusty texture and suggests long-term aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Albert Morot 2018 Cent-Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Already showing some toasty maturity, this blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir is delicate, yeasty and rounded. Coming from northern Burgundy, it has a cool climate feel, textured with orange zest and the crispest acidity. It is ready to drink, although another few years in bottle will improve it even more.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2017 Egarade  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A solid, dense wine, packed with tannins and with a dry core. The soft fruit has flavors of strawberry, hinting at richness to come. At this early stage, tannins and acidity are still forming. Hold for five years.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Beaumonts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: There is a voluptuous edge to this generous wine. It has rich flavors, some strawberry and plum juice. The final extreme freshness shows through the layer of firm tannins. For aging over 4–5 years.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A blend of half and half Chardonnay and Aligoté, this is a mineral textured wine that is shot through with acidity and green fruits. It is crisp, light and bright, and refreshingly ready to drink.
title: Cave de Bissey NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: The wine is ripe, balanced and likely to be ready to drink soon. With its plump fruitiness and texture, it is a full wine. Rich red-berry fruits are gently balanced by acidity and supported with a light layer of tannins. It will be very drinkable from late 2021.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2020 Charmes  (Santenay)

description: The wine comes from the highest point of the slope above Santenay, giving it an attractive cool and crisp character. With its delicious, refreshing acidity as well as ripe pear flavors it is balanced, minerally and with fine acidity. The aftertaste confirms that the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2020 Comme Dessus  (Santenay)

description: This ripe wine is full of minerality and rich white and yellow fruit. Still young, it's deliciously creamy and bright, showing great potential for aging into something serious. Drink from 2024.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2020 Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This normally cool Premier Cru has done particularly well in the 2019 vintage. This bottling is ripe and full of white fruit, while keeping a strong line of fine, tight acidity. It will be ready to drink soon, so only wait until 2022.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2021 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From vineyards outside the main village appellations of the Côte de Nuits, this is a firm, almost austere wine. It has a dry extract character that is suppressing the red plum and berry fruit flavors. Give it time, although it is probably always going to be dry.
title: Louis Max 2019  Côtes de Nuits Villages

description: Produced by the cooperative of the Hautes Côtes, this wine is bright and fruity. It has light tannins and warm, red cherry character. With its acidity and structure it could age, although not for long. Drink from 2022.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2021  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

description: From the hills to the west of Nuits-St.-Georges, this is a crisp, red berry-flavored wine. It has light tannins and juicy, perfumed fruit—all in balance and ready to drink soon, from 2022.
title: Pierre Gruber 2020  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: The wine is ripe with a fine mix of generous fruits and layers of toast. It is an opulent wine, full of fruitiness and with a crisper side from juicy acidity. Produced from 48-year-old vines, it has some fine concentration that gives the wine extra richness. Drink from 2021.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020  Saint-Aubin

description: Ripe and soft, with a texture that is well balanced, this wine has peach and apricot flavors marrying well with the layers of wood. There is a strong, fresh element to give the wine a final lift.
title: Roger Lassarat 2014 Clos de France  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A great swathe of rich, well–defined fruit and a complex texture of pear and apple skins along with the freshest grapefruit and citrus character. This is an intense wine, the fruit fully in focus.
designation: Domaine la Soufrandière Climat les Quarts
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Domaine la Soufrandière Climat les Quarts  (Saint-Véran)

description: Initially soft, this wine then reveals a firmer structure, and a salty and mineral texture. There is an element of toastiness, rounding out the crisp apple and citrus fruit flavors. A cool, elegant wine.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013 Les Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: A wine that is broad, feeling full-bodied, with weight, pear and quince fruit flavors. The wine is attractively plump, toast and acidity adding richness. It opens slowly to give a rich aftertaste.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Rives de Longsault
title: Collovray et Terrier 2013 Domaine des Deux Roches Rives de Longsault  (Saint-Véran)

description: A good contrast between weighty, rich fruit and a steely structure. White fruits and acidity offer freshness, while the more austere edge gives the wine a serious, solid character. For aging.
title: Domaine Michel Bouzereau 2014 Le Limosin  (Meursault)

description: Full in the mouth, round and rich, the wine is finely structured, fresh and ripe at the same time. Delicious.
title: Daniel Barraud 2014 Alliance  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A rounded wine, with a counterpoint of apple skin texture, the fruit flavors offering acidity as well as green plums. The texture is plush, velvet, delicious.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Big and broad with fruit that is full and ripe, packed with golden apple flavors. It has great texture and sweetness, with a well-judged touch of vanilla from the wood.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Goutte d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Strong wood aromas show in the toasty edge of this spicy wine. Ripe yellow fruits are full in the mouth, with a crisp, bright aftertaste to give a final lift.
title: Domaine Carrette 2022  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: The red wine from this vineyard (which also produces a white) is firm with layers of toast from wood aging as well as the potential for ripe red fruits. It is going to need some time to lose that spicy flavor that currently dominates the wine. Give it until 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2021 Les Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This aromatic wine is delicious Pinot Noir. With fine ripe red fruits that are shot through with tannins for aging and crisp acidity for refreshing drinking, this is a rich wine that should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2021 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This rounded wine is soft and ripe. Along with its smooth, warm texture it offers generous pear and melon flavors. Acidity adds an attractive final crispness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021  Saint-Véran

description: This smooth and creamy wine is spicy with wood aging and rich with yellow fruits. It presents a generous character, rounded and open. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2021 Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This mango-flavored wine is ripe, generous and fruity. Its richness and spice are right up front. It is a gorgeous wine, smooth, creamy and ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2021 Domaine du Bois Rosier  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine is ripe and warm with generous red-berry fruits and touches of spice. The wine is rounded, full of fruitiness with a layer of tannins that is nicely judged to give support and breadth to the fruit. Drink from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: Touches of wood, not new, give this wine spice and roundness. It is an attractive, citrus-flavored wine, with yellow fruits coming from behind as the wine opens up. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Marsannay

description: This smooth wine has a rounded, soft texture, but acidity and a citrus edge creep into the peach and pineapple fruits. Drink now.
title: Meurgey-Croses 2021 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This ripe wine is already delicious with its full, bold fruits and peach and mango flavors. It's full of rich fruits and touched lightly by spice. Drink this generous wine from 2022.
title: Rijckaert 2021  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is tight and closed up. It does suggest plenty of fruit weight, hinting at toast and apple flavors that will come through over the next several years to give a rich wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2021 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: The wood-aging flavors show strongly in this ripe wine, balancing with the apple acidity and the touches of green-plum fruits. A streak of minerality adds to the complexity of this delicious wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2021 Les Ecussaux Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: This wine is ripe, rounded with a smooth vanilla and spice texture that complements the yellow fruit and rich pear flavors. The wine is generous and likely to age quickly. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2021 Dessus des Golardes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a tight, tangy wine, laced with attractive wood flavors. Plenty of crisp citrus and spicy flavors balance each other. It is already delicious, so drink now.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2022  Mâcon-Verze

description: A ripe and soft wine, this is impressively rich for a Pinot Noir grown so far north in Burgundy. It has hints of red fruits along with pear and tight citrus minerality. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine comes from a four-acre parcel of 55-year-old vines. It has the concentration that is so special to old vines. That goes with the ripe red fruits and generous tannins that give the wine great richness. It is a young wine still even though so fruity and will be better to drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Volnay)

description: The mature vines in the name of the wine are 40-years-old. The result is a firm structured wine although one with plenty of soft red fruits in the background. They are developing well, bringing with them acidity and good potential. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2020 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Still young and firm, this wine gives indications of potential fruitiness along with a structure that promises concentration. Layers of black fruits and acidity need time to integrate fully with the dark structure and dense texture. Wait to drink this wine for a few more years, at least until 2022.
title: Domaine Maillard 2017  Corton Les Renardes

description: This beautifully perfumed wine comes from one of the highest in elevation premier cru vineyards. The tannins have fully integrated with the red berry and cherry fruits to give a soft, jammy character that contrasts with acidity to give a great lift at the end. Drink this sophisticated wine from 2022.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 Les Chaumées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: From old vines planted in 1955, this dense, impressive wine offers both perfume apple and pear fruits and a creamy texture. Behind this generous front, the wine is tight, steely and needs to age. Give it until 2022.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2019 Fourchaume Premier Cru Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: The two parcels that go into this wine have performed well in 2016. This solid, dense wine is firm with tannins and rich with red plum and berry fruits. It is perfumed, ripe and concentrated. With this structure and with the acidity, it will age, so drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2018 Les Brunettes et Planchots  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This wine, a blend from many Mâcon vineyards, is crisp and full of acidity, making it bright and tangy. Its freshness is up front with apple and citrus fruits. The mineral texture gives an attractive tautness, and the wine is drinkable now.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Terroir du Mâconnais  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is buttery and has a creamy texture along with a fresh streak. Apple flavors are lifted with citrus while also filled out with that rounder character, making for an immediately attractive, ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Carrette 2020 Les Mûres  (Saint-Véran)

description: This wine is round and smooth, with attractive white-fruit flavors. The light acidity is more than compensated by the touch of toastiness and spice. With a juicy aftertaste, the wine is already very enjoyable.
title: Trenel Fils 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Peach and lemon combine in this superripe Chablis. Reflecting the warm vintage, the wine is soft, laced with lime juice acidity and hinting at vanilla and thyme. Round and warm, it is not typical Chablis, much more akin to a Meursault.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Premier Cru Réserve  (Chablis)

description: New wood overwhelms the aromas, and it also dominates the palate of this wine. It just keeps on the right side of drinkability because the spice merges into pear flavors to give an intriguing nutmeg character, while the aftertaste offers freshness. The wine needs at least a year to blend together.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Les Brulés  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Three barrels were made of this structured, tannic wine that offers a juicy balance between acidity and dark tannins. It is perfumed with acidity that cuts through the red berry and dry concentration. It is a dense wine, full of fruit. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2018 Les Beaux Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A simple, fruity wine, this offers attractive citrus flavors and a ripe texture. Yellow fruits add richness while the acidity shoots through at the end.
title: Domaine Chatelain 2019  Petit Chablis

description: This light-colored, soft and supple wine has a palate filled with red fruits. It's immediately drinkable, already showing signs of maturity.
title: Manuel Olivier 2017  Bourgogne

description: This is a classic mineral-driven wine with its intense acidity and bright lemon fruit. Textured and crisp with acidity, it's packed with great fruitiness. From a fine vintage for whites, it has a cool, stylish aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Ripe with a warm character, this wine has both bright red berry fruit and a rich, generous structure. Its fruitiness shows that it's still young—its acidity very much upfront. It will fill out and develop richness with time in bottle. Drink from 2024.
title: Labouré-Roi 2021  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Made from fruit selected across this southern Burgundy appellation, this wine has a touch of minerality and more attractive white fruit. It's rich, soft, full-bodied and fruity. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This beautiful wine is austere at this very young stage. But what pent-up power—the richness comes from glorious ripe fruit, tempered with a core of steel and wrapped with pure lemon, apricot and toast flavors. Age for 10 years at least.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2014  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: A ripe, toasty wine, very buttery. It has rich, almost sweet yellow fruit balanced with a wonderful mineral texture. The wine, of course, is still very young, but shows its future as being rounded and opulent. The acidity that holds it all together shows in the finish.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2014  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: Soft, lightly creamy Chardonnay, pleasantly fruity, offering some apple and pear flavors along with gentle acidity.
title: Barton & Guestier 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: Red fruit dominates this attractive, light wine that shows the acidity of the year while also suggesting light tannins. The aftertaste has a touch of smokiness. It will develop quickly.
title: Faiveley 2020  Bourgogne

description: Light and fruity, this is an attractive, rounded wine. With its bright acidity, touch of minerality and orange-peel flavor, it is open and ready to drink.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2020  Chablis

description: With 62 acres of vines, this estate, which was created by the monks of Cluny, is one of the largest in the Mâcon region. This soft and fruity wine is immediately attractive. Apricot fruits are freshened by green plum and lemon. It is light and ready to drink now.
title: Château de Mirande 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: Tight and crisp initially, this wine opens up with spice, ripe flavors and a touch of minerality. Taut and textured, it needs to age; drink from 2021.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2019  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This ripe, smooth and creamy wine conveys flavors of tropical fruits, apricots and ripe pears. A lightly toasty character gives some spice and richness to the fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink, full of fruit and freshness at the end.
title: Château de Fuissé 2019  Saint-Véran

description: Touches of toastiness give a wine that is ripe, honeyed and accented by smooth caramel. It's a generous wine that has almost sweet acidity. Full and broad in character, it can be drunk now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2019 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: This wine is fresh and full of attractive apple and spice flavors. It is crisp, refreshing and tangy, with a great texture of lemon zest over spicy vanilla and fragrant acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Vins des Personnets 2019  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a very pure wine, all fruit and tight acidity. It is classic Chablis with its tangy, steely edge that gives a lift and structure to the crisp apple fruit flavors. The acidity cuts right through the wine, leaving a refreshing, lively aftertaste.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2020 Côte de Lechet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Offering attractive, tropical-fruit flavors, this wine is smooth and creamy. To balance that, a refreshing moment of tanginess gives a crisp shot of lemon. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2021 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: As if to emphasize that Petit Chablis has an important place in the Chablis hierarchy, the Chablis cooperative produces its aptly named Pas si Petit—”not so little.” It's a soft, immediately drinkable wine, full of ripe lime and pear flavor. It is light and ready to drink.
title: La Chablisienne 2019 Pas si Petit  (Petit Chablis)

description: Very young and crisp, this refreshingly fruity wine has intense acidity, strong citrus flavors and a light, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2020 for its acidity to soften.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020  Mâcon-Villages

description: This wine is ripe and round, with a full, yellow fruit character. It misses out on some initial acidity although a more citrus character does come through at the end. It's rich with a touch of caramel. Drink now.
title: Domaine Michel 2019 Cray  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a rich, round and full-bodied wine with smooth, creamy apple and pear flavors. It is cut through with zingy lemon acidity and a touch of honey. The structure comes from a cool line of lemon zest, minerality and a tight, taut aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: William Fèvre 2019 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With that extra concentration that comes from low-yielding old vines, this has great depth of flavor. It has an apple flavor and crisp, citrusy acidity as well as a more toasty character. Complex and certainly ageworthy, this should keep for at least five years.
designation: Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Premier Cru
title: Pascal Bouchard 2016 Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Deliciously perfumed, this shows some of the structure of the vintage, along with generous raspberry and red cherry flavors. It is rich and solid, and its open character has just the right edge of dense tannins. Already approachable, but it's likely to age over several years.
title: Domaine Heresztyn 2016 Les Millandes Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: Firm, concentrated and solid, this has a tight core that's surrounded by sweeter dark-plum fruit. This is ripe and full bodied, with a definite need for aging.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is very structured and full, with a powerful minerality, citrus and spice flavors, and a tight, nervy character. It has the weight to age for 3–4 years.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Big and fruity, this is very lively, balancing butteriness with green-fruit acidity. The wine is maturing quickly, its tension is fading into rich, wood-flavored fruitiness.
title: Louis Latour 2016 Meursault Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: The minerality is a reminder that the grapes come from an area near Chablis. It has a tangy, zingy character, with a nervy edge that promises aging, but it also provides fruity, apple-driven pleasure now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2013 Vive-la-Joie Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Fruity, ripe and round, this is simple Chardonnay that gives pleasure from its warm texture and softness. The apple flavor leads to a gentle finish.
title: Lupé-Cholet 2016  Bourgogne

description: A dirty nose spoils this otherwise attractive, easy, crisp Chablis. The palate has some notes of yeast and bright white fruit, with a citrusy finish.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2017  Chablis

description: This is a lean, acid-driven wine, without much in the way of generous fruit. It has a green strawberry note, with a light sense of structure and a minerally finish.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 La Minée  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a combination of tropical fruits and tight acidity, making for an unbalanced wine that seems not to know its way.
title: Domaine Verret et Fils 2016  Chablis

description: This is very soft and lacking in definition, with a light texture. However, it does have a crisp apple flavor and a line of acidity that gives freshness.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is powerful, typical of Les Preuses. White and yellow fruits are important to the palate, but so are rich, honeyed toast, minerality and an opulent, intense concentration. This is impressive, elegance with power, and worth aging for several years.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a rare venture by Olivier Leflaive outside his home territory around Puligny, Chassagne and Meursault. The wine is classic Corton-Charlemagne, big and bold, a broad-shouldered wine that brings together toastiness, ripe pineapple and mango and balancing, lively acidity. It is already giving great pleasure, but should last well over the next decade.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Sumptuous and rich, a fully gorgeous Chardonnay, with butter and citrus flavors combining with panache. The wine just fill the mouth, a succession of pineapple, soft toast, spice and mango flavors, finished with acidity. To drink now, but it is worth keeping for 2–3 years.
title: Xavier Monnot 2012 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A rich, mouthfilling,  sophisticated wine. The secret is in the balance, with the concentrated fruit flavors—dried apricot, mango and lemon—in just the right proportion. It tastes delicious now, but will certainly age over five years or more.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2012 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A beautiful, ripe wine that shows the richness of 2010 in Chablis. The wine revels in its yellow fruit flavors, apricots, peaches even pineapple, underscored by new wood flavors. Then acidity comes through, a fresh lift that leaves the wine with a clean, smooth finish. And once these initial fruits soften, the secondary flavors promise some good aging. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A superb wine. It opens slowly in the mouth, revealing layers of toast followed by intense white and green fruits. Spice and nutmeg accent the kiwi, pepper and pineapple notes, all concentrated around a core of minerality. Age for at least four years.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2012 Clavoillon Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This steely, mineral, structured wine speaks of the chalk soil of Puligny. It is firm and crisp, even though the fruit is rich. The wine layers the white fruits and mandarin orange zest with some judicious toast from the wood, leaving spice and ripe acidity on the finish.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011 Champs Gains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A rich and fruity wine with dense cherry and strawberry fruits and a dry, tannic structure. It has a tough edge that suggests aging potential while also bringing out a ripe character from this southernmost appellation in the Côte d'Or.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Clos Roussots Premier Cru  (Maranges)

description: Good, rich, fruited wine,with lively acidity and a pure fresh character. There is some maturity here, a wine with a fine texture, finishing with rich toast.
title: Simonnet-Febvre NV Pinot Noir Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Beautifully perfumed wine, with fresh red fruits and some fine tannins. The wood element is perhaps too dominant for the weight of the wine. Hopefully this will subside. Give it 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2013 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A fine, fruity but structured wine. It brings together many attractive elements of crisp fruits, ripe peaches, toast and a definite tight structure for aging. Keep for 2–3 years.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2013  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A ripe, red berry-fruit flavored wine, highlighted with sweet cherries. At this young stage, it shows more fruit than structure. Tannins are here, likely to flesh out the wine as it develops. For the moment, enjoy the great swathes of sweet fruit.
title: Domaine Chandon de Briailles 2012 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Dark and structured, powered by smoky tannins and plum skin texture. The wine is just beginning, its weight an indication of good aging potential. It is firm and dense, the acidity providing an attractive final freshness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013  Grands-Echezeaux

description: With its fine tannic structure, plum juice sweetness and beautifully ripe fruits, this is a wine that combines structure with a rich velvet coat. The acidity gives a fine lift, bringing out strawberries and a final piercing freshness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This has the great aromatic complexity you expect from Rugiens. Generous and full textured, this is a full-bodied, rounded wine. Sweet red fruits, touched by spice, are well balanced with a streak of acidity. Wait for four years, at least.
title: Domaine de Courcel 2013 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: From Tramier's own vineyards, this is a soft, fleshy wine with a light touch. The tannins are already gentle and the red berry fruits are highlighted by crisp acidity. For short-term aging only.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Château Mi-Pont  (Mercurey)

description: Peach and pear flavors give a rich feel to this warm wine. It has vanilla and cream flavors, with a citrus character that cuts through the ripeness on the finish. Ready to drink.
title: Denis Dutron 2016  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: This shows good crispness, with an apple flavor and zesty acidity. The fruitiness is balanced by a mineral edge and a touch of caramel.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2016  Chablis

description: Round and rich, this has delicious acidity and touches of tropical fruits. It's ripe and full bodied, with an attractive hint of wood.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Prestige  (Bourgogne)

description: Fragrant and perfumed, this has a smoky character and crisp fruit, while remaining attractively ripe. The tannins are soft, and the acidity on the finish is fruity.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2016 Les Dames Huguettes  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: After several years working in wine commerce and tourism, Céline Guguen-Brocard in 2017 studied winemaking. This is a bright result in partnership with Frédéric Gueguen, a former winemaker for her father, and Jean-Marc Brocard. This rosé is bright, crisp and full of cranberry fruit and tangy acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2022 Domaine Marie B.  (Bourgogne)

description: A simple, soft Chardonnay from the Mâconnais region, this is rounded. A touch of caramel adds extra flavor to the warm fruit. Green plum and melon dominate this wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2022  Mâcon-Villages

description: A rounded wine that is soft and fruity, the flavors edged with toast. There is an attractive citrus flavor that gives some crispness to what feels a fat wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Marc Jambon 2015 Cuvée Fût de Chêne  (Mâcon-Pierreclos)

description: In this powerful, full-bodied wine, soft fruit accompanies the firm tannins. The wine is already well integrated, showing dense red fruits as well as structure. A touch of wood will soften soon. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2017 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Full of bright yellow fruits, this is ripe, rounded and already delicious. Rich mango and peach flavors contribute an exotic edge to the more mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine La Soufrandise 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft and gently fruity, it's fairly basic but does provide a Pinot Noir character. The wine has red cherries, light acidity and a jammy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Louis Chavy 2018  Bourgogne

description: A crisp wine, this is packed with acidity and fruitiness. It is tangy, tight, full of attractive acidity as well as lively citrus and white fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Albert Bichot 2019  Saint-Véran

description: This mineral, structured wine is full of lemon, crisp green apple and fragrant acidity. It's ripe while also fresh and taut. A tangy texture shoots through the wine, giving a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: A wine with great fruit and balance, this is totally ready to drink. Harmony between the juicy acidity and yellow fruits gives the wine richness, intensity and an intensely fresh aftertaste.
title: Christophe Cordier 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A soft, simple and attractively fresh wine, this is ready to drink. It has all the crisp acidity you could want alongside riper yellow fruits and a soft, gentle texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Thierry Drouin 2019 Domaine du Vieux Puits  (Macon-Bussières)

description: Bright and fruity, this is a wine to be enjoyed now. It's crisp acidity, but concentrated with creamed-apple flavors and broadened by a touch of wood.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Prestige  (Bourgogne)

description: The wine comes from what many consider to be the Grand Cru of Nuits Saint-Georges. It is firm and structured with solid tannins over black-cherry fruits. There is a tight streak of acidity that cuts through the wine giving a crisp center to the fine fruit. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2020 Les Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The Belland family has an acre of vines in this prestigious Premier Cru. Ripe while shot through with intense acidity, the wine is finely balanced. Touches of wood aging give the wine a creamy toasty texture. That contrasts with the more mineral fruity character that leaves the wine crisp at the end. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2019 Les Champs Gains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: The aptly named vineyard is good at producing wines that are deceptively approachable when young and which age so well. This Meursault follows that model: a generous wine with its ripe spice and yellow fruits. They are balanced by the more citrus and green-plum flavors. Full of fruit while also structured for aging, the wine will be best from 2023.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: From vines in the heart of this large appellation, this is a warmhearted and ripe wine. With wood and spice in equal balance with the white fruits, this is a juicy crisp wine full of great acidity and also with a ripe hint of yellow fruits. This fine wine will be best from 2024.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020 Poruzots Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This vineyard, at 900 feet, gives a cool take on Chardonnay. It is tight, structured and mineral in character. Vanilla from the wood aging mingles with the taut citrus fruit. The richness will develop as the apricot flavors develop. Drink this fine wine from 2023.
designation: Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Roux Père et Fils 2020 Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This Premier Cru is situated in the southern half of Savigny, close to Beaune proper. Here it has produced a ripe generous wine full of spicy smoky red fruits and balanced acidity. The wine is still showing its baby fruit and needs time. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2020 Les Hauts Jarrons Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a rounded full-bodied wine that has red-fruit fleshiness as well as fine tannins for the future. It comes from 70-year-old vines on the southeast facing slopes that make up Volnay's Premier Cru vineyards. Rich in black fruits and dark smoky tannins, the wine also has intense young acidity. Drink this impressive wine from 2024.
title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2020 Champans Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A rare white wine from Morey Saint-Denis, with great acidity and freshness. The wine is bright, with lemon crispness, and light hints of wood.
title: Domaine Dujac 2015  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: Finely perfumed, with berry fruits that freshen the more severe tannins. The wine has concentrated structure, smokiness as well as fresh acidity. The finish is dry and firm.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Pommard

description: Open and charming as its name suggests, the wine is ripe and soft. The acidity is somewhat lost in the sweet, almost tropical fruit.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Charmes  (Meursault)

description: This wine is ripe yet still crisp, with a touch of honey flavor and apricot fruit lending ripeness, pulled taut by a tang of orange zest-like acidity. It's delicious and ready to drink, finishing on mineral texture.
title: Maison Matisco 2020  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a ripe, round and full-bodied wine. It has a touch of nutmeg as well as bright acidity and sliced-apple flavors. It is immediately attractive, richly packed with fruit and finishing with spice and toast.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Always an impressive vineyard, it has produced a dense wine in this vintage. It's full of both intense, perfumed red fruits and smoky, dusty tannins that give an elegant structure. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Ripe and sweet, this wine is full of generous red plums and berries. It is immediately attractive with its spice, structure and tannins playing a supporting role to the almost jammy fruit. Acidity at the end adds some attractive freshness to this ripe wine. Drink from 2024
title: Domaine Huguenot 2020 La Montagne  (Marsannay)

description: This fruity wine has soft and tannins and a jammy backdrop. It is ripe and full in the mouth with strawberry and red plum jelly flavors. Drink now. This is one of the first vintages since Labouré-Roi, which was hit by scandal in 2016, passed into new ownership.
title: Labouré-Roi 2020  Bourgogne

description: A rich, full-bodied while also crisp wine. It has some bottle age giving an edge of toastiness to this blend of four grapes, Pinot Noir, Gamay, Chardonnay and Aligoté. There is a good orange zest tang, a steely edge and tight final acidity.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A complex, full-bodied wine that is full of mature fruit flavors with a touch of toast to add to the attractive mix. With apple, quince and almonds well blended together, this is a finely balanced wine, that could age for a couple of years more.
title: Louis Bouillot 2013 Perle d'Or Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: For the vintage, this is a surprisingly soft wine. It's already juicy, full of fresh strawberries and soft tannins. That makes for a delicious wine, rounded with a touch of wood. It's not likely to age much beyond 2021,  but is certainly attractive now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Vaucrains Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A perfumed wine, it's rich and full of ripe berry flavors. Solid tannins are integrating well into the fruitiness. It feels dense and with good potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 La Mazière  (Fixin)

description: Big and fruity, this rich wine offers warm tropical fruits as well as crisper lemon acidity. It shows a touch of steeliness, but emphasizes fully ripe fruits that are immediately appealing. Drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2018 En Combe  (Saint-Véran)

description: A dark-hued wine, it's richly fruity with spice and wood flavors. It is ripe, full in the mouth, offering solid tannins as well as attractive acidity. It's suited for medium-term aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017  Marsannay

description: An impressively powerful wine, with packed acidity, sweet fruits and ripe tannins. The wine has great density, a dusty texture, the fruit powering through while preserving the relative austerity of the vintage.
title: Camille Giroud 2014 Corton le Rognet  (Corton)

description: Offering both richness and absolute freshness, the wine layers ripe white and yellow fruits, creamed apple flavors and a great line of mineral texture and citrus flavor. It will age, give this 6 years.
title: Camille Giroud 2014 Le Champ Gain  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A wine with great weight, density and structure from a well-positioned parcel of vines. The juicy plum flavors affirm the potential for opulence as the wine ages.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015 Clos Vougeot  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: Firmly tannic wine, with balancing ripe fruit well under the structured layers. The weight of the wine comes from the rich and generous black plum fruit and acidity. A wine for long-term aging.
title: Domaine de la Pousse d'Or 2015 Clos de la Bousse d'Or  (Volnay)

description: All the proper structure of young Gevrey-Chambertin with the addition of rich, generous fruit. The core is of wood and dry fruit tannins, the fruit of rich black plum juice. At this stage, the wine is firm. Give it 5–6 years to open up.
title: Domaine Dujac 2015 Les Combottes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Rich, opulent and spicy, with a great balance between wood and fruit. The generous black plum and black currant fruit is delicious, balanced by taut acidity. Keep for 3-4 years.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2015 Champans  (Volnay)

description: Very mineral, textured wine, its acidity and taut green fruit flavors firmly in evidence. It has some of the richness and opulence of the vintage, with great swathes of ripe yellow fruits developing. For long-term aging.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Bâtard-Montrachet  (Bâtard-Montrachet)

description: Firmly structured wine, which also boasts delicious jammy fruit, very ripe, very opulent. The tannins are sweet and rich, suggesting aging potential over 7–8 years and more. An impressive wine.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Charmes Chambertin  (Charmes-Chambertin)

description: A wine that is very mineral, very structured in its tannins, the black fruits flavors a straight line cut through with acidity.
title: Camille Giroud 2014 Latricières Chambertin  (Latricières-Chambertin)

description: This spicy, toasty wine currently shows more wood than fruit. Hints of yellow fruits are already there, so the texture should open to give a riper, fruitier wine. Give it until 2024.
title: Domaine Françoise André 2021  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This Côte Chalonnaise appellation has done well in 2019 with its broad, ripe wines. This wine has the same character, with touches of wood and concentration from old vines. It is rich, the yellow fruits cut with some acidity. Drink this full, ripe wine wine from 2023.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2021 Vielles Vignes Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: A chunky wine, packed with tannins that fill out the dark plum and black cherry fruits. It's solid, if on the dry side, with fine acidity.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: This is rounded and soft, with wood and spice flavors. There's an intriguing touch of ginger, along with a salty, mineral character.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2015 Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Showing bright white fruits shot through with citrus, this ripe wine is intense in its freshness. It is very pure in its character with a great line of acidity. The hints of wood are modest, giving a wine that is all mineral fruitiness. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2020 Champ Gain Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: While this wine has slightly rustic aromas, the flavor is lively, ripe and bright with good acidity and a thrust of steel that gives minerality. Tight and crisp, the wine will take a while to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Fourchaumes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Only two acres in size, this southeast facing vineyard has produced a ripe, spicy wine. Soft peach and pineapple flavors are rich and opulent. A tang of acidity over the wood aging gives the wine shape. It is still young, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Château de Lavernette 2019 Vers Châne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The Côte Chalonnaise gives a fruity while structured style of red Burgundy. It's juicy, with red cherries and berries giving a bright character behind the still-present tannic structure. It's ready to drink, although it will be better in 2019.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2018 Bourgogne  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This soft wine shows gentle Chardonnay flavors. Toast and yellow fruits are blended with minerality to give a ripe texture that doesn't need to age.
title: Barton & Guestier 2019 Passeport  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: An attractive wine from Chitry, south-west of Chablis, this is fresh, soft and fruity. It lacks complexity, but does have bright apple and pear flavors and refreshing acidity. It's a great apéritif wine, ready to drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2018 Chitry  (Chablis)

description: Wines from Morey-Saint-Denis should be opulent in 2009, and this wine has opulence in spades. It fills the mouth with rich red plums, red cherries and some cranberry juice to give an edge of dryness. Maybe complexity is edged out by all this juicy fruit, but the tannins do firm up the wine, which should certainly age 10 years or more.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011  Clos de la Roche

description: Big, burly Pinot Noir, dominated by black cherries, rich fruit and firm tannins. This is wine that shows richness, with a smoky, chewy structure and great spice and aromatic perfumes. The juiciness comes through on the finish, but never leaves the structure behind.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This ripe, almond- and pear-flavored wine has a fine balancing structure of green fruit skins. It's certainly rich, but it also has elegance, restraining its exuberance through the finishing acidity, which promises 5–7 years' aging.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Beaune du Château Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: For a Savigny, this is surprisingly firm and tannic, the wine's structure an impressive edifice of dry tannins and firm cranberry and plum skin flavors. It is certainly ripe, the fruit promising attractive richness in 3–5 years, followed by good aging potential.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Intensely perfumed, this wine shows both strength and great elegance. The raspberry flavors float over a light structure of some dry tannins. The acidity is there, but it is the generosity of the fruit that is most obvious, going right through the wine to the sweet, jammy finish.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2011 Les Cras Premier Cru  (Vougeot)

description: This wine is crisp, tangy and bright with acidity. With a lively touch of vanilla and spice over the crisp fruitiness, it is developing well. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2021  Saint-Véran

description: Pure Pinot Noir from the south of Beaujolais, this is soft, fruity and with attractive acidity. Red fruits and a crisp acidity give this wine its bright character. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Les Pierres Dorées  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a soft wine, with simple, ripe fruit flavors. It has weight, pear and melon flavors and an attractive, juicy zesty aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2022 Sur la Roche  (Mâcon-Vergisson)

description: This soft wine, full of ripe apricots and melons, summarizes this rich white-wine vintage. It is creamy, laced with just enough acidity and fruity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is tight, with layers of yellow fruit and spice that are masked by wood flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Hervé Kerlann 2021  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is crisp and deliciously fruity. With bright acidity, apple and citrus flavors and a strong mineral texture, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2022  Mâcon-Cruzille

description: A gentle wine with open and generous soft berry fruits showing through dusty tannins and lively acidity. This is likely to develop relatively fast into a delicious wine.
title: Louis Jadot 2011 La Dominode Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: As befits a single vineyard Gevrey Chambertin, this is a structured wine, firmly rooted in tannins. Hidden beneath are black plum and cherry flavors that are raring to go—rich and sumptuous. It's a wine for aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Les Evocelles  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This is an attractive, fast-maturing wine with soft tannins, ripe fruits and a juicy, perfumed acidity. It has considerable weight and concentration, along with firm red-plum and berry flavors. It's an elegant wine that should be drunk from 2021.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 Cuvée Signature  (Clos de la Roche)

description: Very mineral in style, this is a structured, textured wine with good aging potential. It's acidity, still pronounced and up front, reveals itself with crisp citrus flavors that accent warm yellow fruits. The wine needs a year or two before drinking, so wait until 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Opulent, ripe and fruity, this is classic Saint-Aubin. Generous fruitiness is balanced with crisp acidity and touches of minerality and spicy wood. Its fruitiness makes it accessible now, but several years' aging will make it even better and certainly more complex.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2017 Sur Gamay Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: An earthy wine with rich, red fruits along with a barnyard flavor. The wine is ripe and jammy, the juicy acidity coming through at the end.
title: Domaine Thierry Mortet 2015  Bourgogne

description: This firmly structured, dense wine is packed with dark plum and fig fruits, laced with chocolate and tannins. It's a solid, foursquare style of wine, with acidity and fruit forming a fine partnership. Like many wines from this year, it is likely to mature quickly, so drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2017 Les Charbonnières  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a dense and rich wine that shows both smoothness as well as an edgy mineral texture. It's weighty on the palate with ripe white and yellow fruits and a rounded, juicy character. Fruit and wood aging are still coming together, so give it some time. Drink this stylish wine from 2020.
designation: Cuvée Signature Les Chenevottes Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2017 Cuvée Signature Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Lightly perfumed, this soft, single-vineyard wine is full of black-cherry fruits. Its acidity and round texture make it a wine to drink young. Drink from 2022.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2022 La Minée  (Bourgogne)

description: This rounded, smooth wine has attractive ripe fruitiness. A tangy edge adds extra interest to an easy, open wine. Drink now.
title: Loron et Fils 2022 La Crochette  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is a crisp, lively and fruity wine, bright with acidity and lightly textured. A vanilla edge adds extra interest. Drink now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2022 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is soft, rounded and already ripe. With its gentle acidity and touches of spice and pepper, it is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Château La Greffière 2022 Sous le Bois  (Mâcon La Roche Vineuse)

description: This blend of Gamay and Pinot Noir is soft and ripe with red fruits. The wine is all fruit: red cherry and raspberry with a light touch of spice and tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2021 Buissonnier  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a new wine from this negociant house that specializes in limited production wines. It is a smooth and rounded wine, ripe with apples and yellow fruits as well as being cut with acidity. The wine is refreshing and crisp at the end with a touch of minerality.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is produced from vines aged 62–88 years old. It has ripe red fruits and soft tannins creating a wine that is generous and ready to drink. It is a blend of grapes from the flat lands beyond the slopes in the Côte d'Or. The wine finishes with acidity as well as attractive fruitiness.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Grapes from the small village of Saint-Bris le Vineux west of Chablis are used in this attractive, crisp and fruity wine. It has a strongly mineral tang to its fruitiness with lemon zest and intense acidity. The aftertaste is softer, rounded and ready to drink.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Paul Delane Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A blend that includes Aligoté along with the traditional Champagne grapes, this is lively and bright. Fresh apples and a soft aftertaste make for an easy to drink wine that is lit with final acidity.
title: Cave de Bissey NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine reflects the ripeness of the vintage while still retaining crisp minerality. Creamed apples are balanced with a tangy texture and soft acidity. The wine finishes with a crisp aftertaste that gives a great lift. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2021  Chablis

description: This is an attractive red-fruit flavored wine with fine acidity as well as juicy berries and cherry. Its soft tannins are just right to sustain the delicious fruitiness. Dink this wine from 2021.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Domaine de la Ferté  (Givry)

description: Showing the ripe 2019 vintage, this is a soft rounded wine. It has attractive acidity to lift the ripe yellow fruit and add a shot of citrus. The wine needs another few months to settle in, so wait until summer 2021.
title: Etienne Boileau 2021  Chablis

description: Now in its 14th generation, this domaine has produced a ripe wine from this single parcel. It's both structured and packed with red fruit and acidity, reflecting its vintage. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Guy & Yan Dufouleur 2020 Aux Saint-Julien  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with bright acidity and red berry fruit that comes across as lean. Its structure and tannic core suggests it needs to age. Drink from 2023.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2021 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A small, acre-sized parcel gives a wine that has both great structure and finesse. It retains the natural fruitiness of the vintage as well as a more defined texture. Concentration and densely ripe fruit are already finely integrated with the hints of wood. The wine speaks of long aging potential; don't drink before 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: Rounded and rich, it is full of dark fruits and red cherries that combine with firm tannins and great acidity. This comes from a parcel of the Corton Rognets Grand Cru that unusually has been given the Faiveley name. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2017 Clos des Cortons Faiveley  (Corton-Rognet)

description: This dark, brooding wine is still tight and closed. It's powerful and concentrated, with gripping tannins as well as delicious black fruits. It's solid, chunky and very firm while retaining the generous fruitiness of the vintage. Don't drink before 2024.
title: Alex Gambal 2017  Clos de Vougeot

description: From vines owned by the Chanson family, this is a wonderfully rich wine, deliciously fruity at the same time. Apple and citrus as well as richer apricots come through powerfully. It's structured with a sense of opulence, richness that also has a tight texture. It needs to age; drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Chanson 2017 Héritiers Paul Chanson  (Corton Vergennes)

description: This is richly powerful, packed with dark plum fruits and solid, concentrated tannins. At this stage, it is closed, a potential powerhouse of firm fruits and structure. It has weight, the fruit and the firm texture all promising long-term aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2017  Chapelle-Chambertin

description: This is the big one, one of the most treasured white wine vineyards in the world. And the wine is magnificent, balanced with restrained power and style. Yellow fruits are shot through with acidity that conveys a nervy texture and an intense, concentrated character. This needs many years; don't drink before 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2017  Montrachet

description: Power and concentration exude from this wine. Very structured, very firm, it has solid tannins backed up by powerful black, juicy fruits. Blackberry flavors are still developing in this seriously ageworthy wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Alex Gambal 2017  Latricières-Chambertin

description: This is a powerful wine with complex structure, dense fruits and a solid texture. It's dry, firm, dark and still very young. The core of the wine is still tannin, the black cherry fruit giving so much richness before the fresh acidity cuts in. Drink from 2022.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2017  Corton

description: A specialty of Chanson, this small premier cru gives a perfumed, dark and tannic wine. The dense, firm structure gives a dramatic base to the ripe black fruits, balanced acidity and a touch of wood that smoothes the wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Chanson 2017 Clos des Fèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: One of the flagship wines of Louis Latour, this has great weight, richness and ripe yellow fruits, all surrounded by wood and citrus flavors. A sense of mineral in the texture adds complexity, while the firm structure needs to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2017  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Very terroir-driven from chalk soil in this great vineyard, this firmly structured wine is powerful and solid. There is a mineral character at this stage of the wine's development, with 60% new wood giving a lightly smoky feel. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Chantal Lescure 2017 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A firmly structured wine, packed with fruit, acidity and complex tannins. It is powerful, dark and rich with great weight to balance the dry, smoky character from wood aging. It's impressive, concentrated with a touch of licorice and spice that  cuts through the acidity. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2017  Latricières-Chambertin

description: This wine has a bright, crisp character that is reminiscent of Chablis. It has refreshing lemon and apple flavors, and it's ready to drink.
title: Antonin Rodet 2016 Château de Mercey  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a round, soft wine that shows the jammy character of Pinot Noir. It has a straight line of acidity that cuts through the fruit, which makes for an attractive, light finish.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2016 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: Light and fruity, this has flavors of creamed apple and ripe Williams pear. The wine is crisp and tangy, and it's shot through with lemon zest and acidity. Ready to drink in one year.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2017 Cuvée Ancestrum  (Chablis)

description: Nicolas Potel's entry-level Burgundy is an elegant, fruity wine, with soft tannins, rich strawberry fruit and a ripe feel. It is ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: A ripe, balanced wine that has juicy red strawberry and raspberry fruits and fine acidity to balance. It is warm and rounded, full of dense fruits, with its tannins surrounded by the cushion of the fruit. Drink this already delicious wine from 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2021 Planchots  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Structured and firm with fine red fruits and acidity, this is a wine that brings out all the structure of the appellation. It has acidity and red cherry and berry fruits that are shot through with a crisp texture. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: From one of the highest of the Mercurey premier crus, this wine has a crisp edge to its otherwise ripe red fruits. It has a fine line of wood as well as the juicy fruitiness and acidity. The wine is already balanced, likely to develop easily and quickly. Drink this from 2023.
title: Château de Santenay 2021 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Dominated by its young tannins, this perfumed wine is bright with acidity. It has spice, an intense, crisp character and the need to age for a considerable time. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2021 Robardelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is a single-vineyard wine which is beautifully rich and already soft and smooth enough to drink. To be sure, it will age further and mellow with time, but for now it is the ripe red-berry fruits and generous tannins that are so attractive. Drink now and until 2026.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos de la Maladière
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Château de Chamirey Clos de la Maladière  (Mercurey)

description: This soft and cushiony wine has light red cherry fruit, gentle tannins and an attractively soft, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Labouré-Roi 2021  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This fruity wine, free from any oak aging, revels in its attractive tropical flavors. It's as ripe and rich as the vintage suggests, with light, balanced acidity. The aftertaste is soft, keeping up the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Labouré-Roi 2021  Mâcon-Villages

description: This light, fruity, strawberry-flavored wine has good acidity, soft tannins and just a touch of softness from ripe fruit. It's ready to drink, but will be best from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016 Le Village  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Now perfectly ready to drink, this wine from vines close to Pouilly-Fuissé is ripe with yellow fruit, juicy acidity and a smooth texture. It has plenty of minerality to keep it bright and lively. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2019 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and crisply fruity. It has the bright, tight texture of the vintage, giving a tense character while retaining the lush, poised fruit of the vintage. It's delicious now and ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020 Les Plantés  (Saint-Véran)

description: Produced from old, low-yielding vines, this delicious wine balances crisp acidity with intense white fruit. It's poised and stylish, with a cool character expressed in its acidity and lemon zest-like aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2020 Les Sentinelles  (Saint-Véran)

description: From the northernmost appellation of the Côte de Nuits, this firm and solidly tannic wine comes from one of the vineyards on the list to get Premier Cru approval in the near future. Its tannins are well balanced already with the red-berry fruit and bitter-cherry flavors that are shot through with acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2019 Champs-Perdrix  (Marsannay)

description: With all the freshness of the vintage, this fruity wine shows good balance between tangy acidity and crisp apple and green-plum fruits. Subtle touches of wood give a spicy, nutmeg flavor to complement the bright fruitiness. Drink from 2022. The vineyard is next door to the Grand Cru Montrachet vines.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2019 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)
