title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2021 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This structured wine is full of fruit and has a tight texture. It shows a creamy side from new wood, although this is well integrated into the fruity acidity and the mineral edge. The wine is likely to age well, ready to drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Château de Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This light and fruity wine has acidity sustaining the red-cherry flavors. It has a dry core along with really juicy flavors and soft tannins. Drink now, although the wine will be even fruitier from 2020.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2019 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This is bitter, with hints of sulfur, yeast and almond. It's soft in texture and lacking fruit.
title: Manuel Seguin 2016  Bourgogne

description: This opulent, powerful wine has weight, richness and a beautiful creamy texture. It's built to age, from its wood aging to its minerality. Concentrated, it offers yellow fruits shot through with acidity. From the grandest Chardonnay vineyard in Burgundy, it will age well and be ready to drink from 2026.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Montrachet

description: Wood, ripe fruit and a tight texture give this wine a very complete feeling. It is structured, mineral-driven and packed with fresh apples and yellow fruit. The impressive structure and balance suggest the wine will age well; drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: A ripe, dense wine, this has powerful fruit and a serious long-term future. It is rich with yellow fruits with a generous, creamy texture, and tight with minerality. This gorgeous wine will certainly age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Latour 2021 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)

description: From the largest Grand Cru in Vosne-Romanée, this wine has plenty of the structure as well as the fruit that shines in this vintage. It is rich and smoky with black fruits and red-berry flavors. The wine is still young, drink from 2026.
title: Louis Latour 2021  Echézeaux

description: This is the Arnoux family's top wine coming from vines on the revered hill of Corton. It is a powerful wine, properly rich and structured from the vintage. Wood and spice come through although they will soon integrate with the dense black-plum fruits and mineral texture. Drink the wine from 2025.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2021 Le Rognet  (Corton)

description: Regarded almost as a Grand Cru in its own right, the Moutonne vineyard, wholly owned by Albert Bichot, is in a corner of the Vaudésir Grand Cru vineyard. In this sumptuous year, the wine is more generous, ripe yellow fruits than mineral texture. The acidity and the tangy aftertaste are a reminder that this is from cool-climate Chablis. Drink from 2023.
title: Albert Bichot 2021 Domaine Long-Depaquit Moutonne  (Chablis)

description: While it has some attractive apple fruits, the wine misses out on the real minerality and texture of Pouilly Fuissé. It's a wine hidden behind net drapes, indistinct.
title: Pierre André 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Rather dull, soapy wine, its fruit missing the right crispness. There are flavors of pear, yellow fruits, just not enough acidity.
designation: Perle d'Ivoire Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Louis Bouillot NV Perle d'Ivoire Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: With its structured, mineral character, this is a serious, ageworthy wine. It has a sense of coiled power and steel and a dense, complex texture that brings out both its ripe, pure fruit character and its intensity. Age this wine for at least 5–8 years.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2016 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A rich wine, full and fruity up front, then opening up into a much more mineral, textured character. It is a great explosion of citrus, pear and green apple, the wood aging showing with subtlety. It's a wine for aging, complex and tight at the end.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2016 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Château Grenouilles is a parcel within the Grenouilles Grand Cru, a monopoly of the La Chablisienne cooperative. The wine is always impressive. It has weight, richness, concentration and considerable potential. Yellow fruits, wood-aging, spice and a firm structure indicate keeping this wine for six years.
title: La Chablisienne 2016 Château Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A taut, nervy, mineral-driven wine, this has intense citrus and grapefruit flavors, lemon grass spice and just the merest hint of wood. It's the structure that gives this impressive wine such power, and a steely edge that will need at least 6–10 years.
title: Domaine Leflaive 2016 Clavoillon Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This powerful wine has considerable structure and considerable acidity that will shine as the wine develops. The fruit is delicious, showing great potential. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2019 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine is smoky with hints of wood. The red-plum fruits are a little suppressed at the moment although the acidity and freshness hint at a good future. It has a cool character with plenty of acidity under the tannins. It will develop, but slowly. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2020 Aux Chaignots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is gentle and rounded, with creamed pear and citrus flavors. With hints of caramel and vanilla, it is soft, clean and very ready to drink.
title: Louis Max 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: This soft, fruity wine is pretty much ready to drink. With its red-berry fruits and fresh acidity it has a crisp side, although its round, ripe texture is so attractive. Drink from the end of 2020.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This wine is structured, dark and dense, with great swathes of smoky tannins plus plenty of red-fruit flavors. With its concentration, structure and richness, the wine will develop well and powerfully. Drink from 2021.
title: Albert Morot 2020 Les Teurons Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This ripe wine comes from vines from two parcels: one normally in the wine, with vines more than more than 60-years-old, the other a hilltop vineyard added in 2018. It is full of rich white fruits that skirt on the zesty side of citrus, giving a crisp edge to this otherwise full wine. It is balanced, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Climat Les Clos Reyssié  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a ripe, rounded and aromatic wine, with just the right stretch of minerality and juicy citrus flavor. Crisp, tangy and refreshing in its fruitiness, the wine is rich and full, finishing with a final burst acidity.
title: Domaine Fourrey 2020 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Warm and fruity, this has an open apricot flavor that's balanced by spice and vanilla from the wood aging. Citrus flavors give a fresh, more medicinal finish.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2015  Chablis

description: The cool character of this under-rated appellation is apparent in this red-currant-dominated wine. With a fresh streak of acidity, the wood and spice flavors are contained and balanced. The wine will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2019 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Lively and fresh, this wine offers apples, citrus and warmer pears. The juicy fruitiness is immediately attractive, perfumed and bright at the end. Drink now.
title: Pierre Vessigaud 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Aged in wood, this wine is ripe, with a smoky character from the toastiness. Next to the spice, the red currant and berry fruits are intensely fresh and disclose a tight line of acidity. The wine is still young, although developing well as the acidity softens. It will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2020 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is still firm, only hinting at its potential. The weight is there as well as the rich fruitiness. Give this wine a few months to bring out the generous fruit and texture. Drink from 2021.
title: Yves Giroux 2020 Les Raidillons  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A hugely rich, powerful Chardonnay, layering ripe fruit with a core of tannic structure, acidity, wood and huge depth of flavor. The wine is concentrated, with layers of fruit and textured acidity. Of course, it needs aging—7 years at least.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Corton-Charlemagne

description: A superbly rich wine, with its acidity well integrated into the concentrated and rounded fruit. It has great texture and fruit that bursts from the glass. It is generous, warm and toasty, while also preserving the steeliness that is hallmark of the Les Clos vineyard. Age for at least five years.
designation: Clos des Hospices Les Clos Grand Cru
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015 Clos des Hospices Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is a smooth, yellow fruit-flavored wine that comes from a small area of the appellation. It has ripe apricot fruit and a toasty, creamy texture, giving it rich, full flavor. A light touch of textured minerality lifts the wine on the finish.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2021 Les Maillettes  (Saint-Véran)

description: A bright, toasty wine, with the ripe fruits of the vintage and characteristics from the wood giving extra richness to this finely structured, mineral-textured wine.
title: Louis Latour 2015 La Garenne  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Structured and dense, with layered tannins and an austere edge. At the same time, the fruit packs concentrated strawberry flavors, acidity and complexities from textured wood.
title: Dujac Fils & Pere 2015  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: Soft and rich, with ripe fruit flavors, this is warm and opulent. Packed with notes of spice and toast, the ripe peach flavor is layered into the fine, elegant structure. Aging will make it even more delicious.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Genevrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Nervy and textured, this is a wine under tension. It is crisp with acidity, with lots of bright green-fruit and citrus flavors. This is complex and age worthy, bringing out the intense texture from the vineyard.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Perrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: In this vintage, Echézeaux reveals an extra edge of really ripe, full fruits. They are balanced by the firm wood- and spice-laden structure, with the tannins and intense acids adding the final touches. Age this over 7–8 years.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015  Echézeaux

description: With wood-based aromas, this is currently a closed, taut wine. It has green fruits and minerality; it's nervy and under tension. The acidity is crisp while very light in character. This is for aging.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2016 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A signature wine for Girardin, this is powerful and rich, with apricot, quince and green plum fruits that are layered within the taut texture. A toast note rounds out this complex, ageworthy wine.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is powerful, ripe and creamily smooth, bearing yellow fruits that dominate the wood aging. It's a rich medley of apricot and yellow peach flavors, laced with citrusy acidity. Full, complex and generous, this is worth aging for over four years.
title: Château de Fuissé 2016 Les Brûlés  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe and wood aged, this is rich with ginger and tropical fruit flavors. Dense and concentrated, it is a full-in-the-mouth wine—powerful and very ageworthy. Give this five years.
title: Château de Fuissé 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The appellation is good at producing soft early drinking wines like this. It is fruity with good acidity and red-currant fruitiness. The tannins are in the background, allowing the wine to age for a few years. Drink this ripe wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Maillard 2020  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: From a single parcel on the Vrignaud domaine, the wine has 30% wood aging. That gives a ripe full character which emphasizes the rich vintage. Toast mingles with rich apples and touches of citrus. Drink this refreshing wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2021 La Champréaux  (Chablis)

description: Rounded and rich, this Blanc de Blancs has both a smooth texture, delicious white fruits and an intense line of acidity. It's clean, fragrant, very fresh.
designation: Perle d'Ivoire Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Louis Bouillot NV Perle d'Ivoire Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wood-aged wine is crisp and displays a great balance between acidity and rich fruits. The wine is still young, although you can see the good acidity, mineral texture and refined toastiness. The elements are coming together to give a wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Chassagne-Montrachet 2017  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: One of a range of wines under the Homage to Heritage import label, this fruit-driven wine has apple and green plum fruits, sustained by great acidity and a crisp, mineral texture. Drink from 2020.
title: Trenel Fils 2020 Homage to Heritage  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This light Chablis is fresh and packed with attractive young fruitiness. It comes from the plateau above the Serein valley and shows its provenance in the cool-climate crispness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2020  Petit Chablis

description: Soft and ripe, a wine that is wide open. With its light and crisp character and attractive yellow fruits, this will develop quickly.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Beaune du Château Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Very lightweight wine, with some attenuated fruit and a dry character. The attraction is the fresh acidity that does offer some compensation for the overoaked flavor.
title: Louis Chevallier 2015  Bourgogne

description: Crisp and tight, this offers bright acidity over a lightly smoky flavor. A green fruit and herb element adds to the general freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Paquet et Fils 2019  Mâcon Chaintré

description: This is a juicy, red-currant-flavored wine. With its round feel and soft, smoky tannins, it has an initial smoothness that is given some bite by the red-berry acidity on the finish.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Smooth and round, this wine is made from grapes that were sourced from the southernmost vineyards of the Côte d'Or. It has a soft, rich and fruity character that shows citrus and white peach flavors, plus a pineapple hint. As it opens, it becomes opulent and full bodied.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2016 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: An elegant yet ripe wine, this comes laced with citrus acidity, and the yellow fruit and melon flavors give it a sense of richness. It's lively and crisp, and it has a toasty base. Age it for 3–4 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Clos Saint-Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: While this wine has the crispness of Chablis, it also has weight and concentration. The bright green-apple flavor is underpinned by a sense of minerality. Nervy, tense yet fruity, this can age for 2–3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Firm and powerful, this tannic wine has dense black-fruit flavors, with enough fruitiness to balance the structure. The finish shows a smoky character, a bitter cherry flavor and bright acidity.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a structured wine, firmly tannic and with considerable wood flavors at this stage. Plenty of rich fruit lies in the background, giving promise for the future. With those red berry flavors and fine acidity in place, this will be a solid, dense wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2018 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This full-bodied wine has swathes of ripe yellow fruits and juicy wood and acidity. Under this opulent surface, a more steely character gives the wine structure that will allow it to age. It will be ready to drink by 2020.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018  Meursault

description: This is a gloriously juicy wine, full of melon, apricot and the brightest citrus flavors. This fruit salad is given structure by the wood and the tangy, zesty edge. It drinks well now, still young and fresh, but will be better aged. Drink from 2020.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2018 Rabourcé Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: This is a smoky, obviously wood-aged wine. The fruit is dominated by the high toast flavors needing time to integrate into the blueberry fruit flavor. That will happen, allowing this crisp, balanced wine to shine. Drink from 2024.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2021 Clos Jus Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: A selection from a single plot of 40- to 70-year-old vines, this full-bodied wine is juicy with a tight texture that comes from the terroir. It offers a crisp edge as well as bright acidity, the apple fruits lifted further by a lemon streak. Drink from 2023.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2022 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wood-aged wine comes from a single vineyard in Mercurey. It is lightly toasty with touches of apricot, a crisper edge of citrus and a mineral aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2021 Le Closeau  (Mercurey)

description: Citrus aromas reveal this wine's essentially crisp character. Plenty of acidity balances the rich white fruits while the mineral texture adds bite to this well-made wine. It will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Domaines Devillard 2021 Domaine de la Garenne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Firmly tannic and structured this is a young wine that will need time to soften. It has the foursquare character that is often found in Nuits Saint-Georges. The fruit weight is there, promising a ripe red-fruit future. The wine should be ready from 2024.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2021 Laurent Dufouleur  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a delicious, crisp wine full of minerality, acidity and a zesty texture. Tight and lively, it offers citrus and green-plum fruitiness with a hint of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2021 Closerie des Alisiers  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: La Chablisienne owns the major part of the Grenouilles Grand Cru, centered on a winery called Château Grenouilles. This wine is powerful and still very young. It has weight and structure along with ripe, generous fruits that are typical of this vineyard. Touched by vanilla from wood aging, it is balancing out now. Drink from 2022.
title: La Chablisienne 2018 Grenouilles Grand Cru Château Grenouilles  (Chablis)

description: From 80-year-old vines, this wine is named after current winemaker Fabien Moreau's grandfather. It's a concentrated, dense wine that is very well structured. Tight, almost shocking acidity is supported by the strong fruit character as well as the fragrant, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
designation: Vaillons Premier Cru Cuvée Guy Moreau
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2019 Vaillons Premier Cru Cuvée Guy Moreau  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is a round, rich and soft style of Chardonnay. It feels generous, and its yellow fruit flavor pushes through the acidity. It slowly opens to reveal complex tropical-fruit notes, and it will develop further, so give it another four years.
designation: Le Clos Blanc Grèves Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2016 Le Clos Blanc Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A rich, spicy wine, this shows flavors of new wood and ripe yellow fruit. The concentrated palate reveals juicy pear and peach juice flavors and a tight, minerally structure. Dense vineyard planting and 35-year-old vines bring out extra intensity and complexity.
title: Roche de Bellene 2016 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a wood-aged style of Chablis, but the toast has been applied discreetly. Rich, full bodied and structured, this wine is full of ripe yellow-fruit, spice and red apple flavors. Its acidity makes this a juicy expression.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A sweet cherry aroma sets the scene for this fruity, firmly structured wine. The juicy red-berry fruit is balanced by a smoky tannic character. This will be a pleasure to drink in a year, and it can also age longer.
title: Roche de Bellene 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Volnay)

description: With grapes from long contracted growers, this wine represents the structure as well as the ripe fruit of the appellation. It imparts a smoky character from wood aging as well as a tense layer of tannins that give it a dry edge. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: A racy wine, juicy, fresh and fruity. The lively red fruits are totally dominant. There is structure, but it is the delicious fruit that speaks.
designation: Beaune Grèves Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2012 Beaune Grèves Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The first mouthful reveals a wine that is just plain opulent and rich. Only on the second taste do dense tannins push their way in, a structure that is concentrated, dry and tight. The fruit flavors are also forward, strawberry juice touched with cranberry juice dryness. This could age well, give it 4–5 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Solid and concentrated, this wine initially is tight, showing minerality as well as rich fruit. The dark tannins then open to reveal sweetness, ripe strawberry jelly as well as soft acidity and licorice. A big wine that will evolve over the next several years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011 Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: With smoky aromas, this starts out as an enticing wine. On the palate, the fruit is surprisingly soft for a Nuits-St-Georges, with the wine's evident structure showing an open character, edged with wood and red plum and currant flavors. The dry tannins give shape, but do not dominate this big wine.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2012 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Big, tannic and foursquare, this is archetypal Pommard. The dark plum and black fig flavors and the rich tannins all contribute to a wine that is solid, concentrated, dense and needs at least four years' aging.
title: Maison Champy 2012 Grands Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Raspberries with hints of cranberry dominate this juicy but structured wine. This is a wine that shows a very elegant style, certainly not forceful, but deliciously direct.
designation: Clos de la Barre Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2012 Clos de la Barre Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: The Dumont family's wine from multiple parcels is ripe, full of spice and rich yellow fruits. Peach and pineapple flavors are lifted by zesty lime that cuts through the richness. Drink from 2021. The family also rents the 16th-century Massey château.
title: Demessey 2020 Clos des Avoueries  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: High-toast aromas from the wood aging are followed on the palate by more layers of toast and spice. Behind this wood and tannin there is plenty of the ripe, soft fruit that is more typical of this appellation. The wine will fill out and give some generous fruit. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2020 Aux Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Attractive spice and green-fruit aromas lead to this fresh, ripe wine. Touches of wood give a spicy buttery taste that contrasts easily with the flavors. Fruity with a light mineral character, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2020 Les Houillères  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, lifted by a shot of acidity. Fragrant yellow fruits and crisper lime are attractively in balance. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2020 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A rich, ripe while still mineral wine, this is concentrated and dense with fruit. It has a good texture as well as a layer of toast that gives extra depth. The wine has spice and a stylish, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2021 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has structure, typical of this appellation, as well as dark black fruits and rich tannins. Acidity cuts through this ripeness, bringing in freshness. Spice and an attractive perfume come along at the end. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2020  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Tense and structured, this is a firm, concentrated wine from the top vineyard in the appellation. It has tight acidity as well as red-currant flavors. The structure is still firm and condensed, and the wine will need time. It has potential; drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Attractive spice and toast aromas add richness to this wine. They lie over the ripe white-stone-fruit flavors that are freshened by citrus. It is still too young to be fully integrated, so wait until 2021 to drink this wine.
title: Marcel Couturier 2020 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: From grapes close to Volnay, this is a ripe, strawberry jam and red-plum-flavored wine. It has soft tannins, juicy acidity and an attractive, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Alex Gambal 2020 Cuvée des Deux Papis  (Bourgogne)

description: This bio wine comes from just over one acre of vines in the appellation's best iron-red terroir. It is ripe and creamy, full of smooth apple-purée fruitiness. A good squeeze of lemon juice gives the wine its crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2020 Climat Les Mûres  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wine is spicy, fruity and immediately attractiv with ripe yellow fruits as well as acidity and zesty lime. Balanced and refreshing, this lively wine is ready to drink.
title: Christophe Cordier 2020  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: From three plots holding 75-year-old vines, this wine offers yellow fruits, apples and crisp pears. Plenty of fresh acidity gives it a crisp character, while the ripe fruit makes it refreshing and very ready to drink.
title: Nicolas Maillet 2020 Le Chenin Blanc  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: The purity of fruit is the most striking aspect of this wine. While it is relatively light in texture, it revels in its fresh red-fruited character that gives an impressive intensity. With balanced touches of tannin and acidity, the wine should age well.
title: Domaine Emmanuel Giboulot 2015 Lulune  (Beaune)

description: Based in Nuits Saint-Georges, Aegerter has its own domaine around the town. This wine, with its new wood and spice flavors, is balanced with red-berry fruits and soft tannins. It will develop well and should be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Full and round, this wine is fruity while smooth and rich. A layer of crisp acidity is surrounded by the generous white and yellow fruits, accented by a touch of toast and spice. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2020  Meursault

description: Ripe and juicy, this dense wine offers red-fruit flavors shot through with acidity. The old vines give depth to the rich wine that finishes with layers of bright fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: Vines situated in the heart of the village give this wine its ripe, generous berry flavor. The tannins, while firm, are integrated into the bold fruitiness. This round while structured wine has good acidity to balance the richness. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2020  Chambolle-Musigny

description: This wine is structured and firm, with some bitterness. Acidity and red-currant fruits bring out the freshness of the year while still needing time to develop. The wine is concentrated and tight at the end. It will take time to be ready, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Vinified in the soft, opulent style of Chambolle, this is ripe and round. With its dry edge and rich fruit, the structure of the apparent is apparent. The acidity cuts through to give a juicy element. Already delicious to drink, but it's worth aging over 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Heresztyn 2016  Chambolle-Musigny

description: This demonstrates a good balance between minerality and ripe pineapple and apricot fruits. With a twist of lemon and an herb accent, it has both crispness and richness.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Les Hautés  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: Underneath the austere exterior, there's a fruity character, with layers of citrus, kiwi and white peach flavors, along with the richness from having been aged in wood. Cellar this taut, minerally and structured wine for 2–3 years.
title: Château Vitallis 2016  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Very minerally in character, this wine has only a touch of wood, showing attractive acidity, citrus fruits and a tight, nervy texture.
designation: Murger des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2016 Murger des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Soft and rounded, this has a raspberry flavor and a fine, full feel. It has the tannic structure of the vintage, which fits into the sumptuous, cushioned texture.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: This wine is ripe, full of yellow fruits and soft acidity. It's creamy and ripe, but cut with orange zest and a mineral texture. It will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2020  Meursault

description: From vines averaging 60 years of age in Jurassic chalky clay, this ripe, buttery wine has plenty of ripe apples, pears and a generous texture. An attractive touch of toast adds to the complexity. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2020 Clos de la Maison  (Saint-Véran)

description: Crisp and tangy, this is a tightly knit wine. Apples and crisp citrus flavors are part of a package that also includes spice, a strong minerality and a perfumed aftertaste. The wine should age a few more months, so drink from 2021. This is a “village” wine in the northern Maçon area.
title: Pierre Merguey 2020  Mâcon-Uchizy

description: This attractive wine has good acidity as well as attractive red berry fruits. It's ready to drink with its soft fruitiness and light tannins.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2017  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: Crisp, very light and fruity, this is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine. A touch of acidity at the end gives freshness.
title: Les Héritiers du Comte Lafon 2018  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: The wine is closed, but has potential. At the moment, the wood and texture dominate, but there are signs of ripe apple and pear fruits that will come through in a few months. Wait until the end of 2018.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: Barrel fermentation and aging have given this wine its ripe character. They have filled it out with spiciness, adding complexity to the yellow fruit and maturing acidity. It's not going to age much further but is very fine to drink now.
title: Nicolas Potel 2018  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Very rich for any Burgundy, this is plump with ginger and pepper as well as yellow fruits. The acidity has been diminished by the ripe fruit, although the wine still has a crisp aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2021  Pouilly-Loché

description: This is a gentle and attractively fruity wine. Ripe and full, it also has a sense of tangy structure and citrus juice. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from summer 2021.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2021  Mâcon-Davayé

description: This wine is from the home vineyard of the Larochette family. It has produced a ripe, still young wine that is full of yellow fruits. Hints of butter and vanilla add a rich dimension to this full-bodied wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2021 Le Château de Chaintré  (Mâcon Chaintré)

description: There is an attractive, smoky touch of wood in this perfumed wine. It has spice, balanced tannins with fine acidity. The wine is still young, showing the wood more strongly than it will in a year's time. Drink from late 2021.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2020 La Créole  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: Old vines in the Côte de Beaune and the Côte Chalonnaise to the south give this wine concentration. It has juicy apricot and green-plum flavors that are spiced lightly with the wood aging. It is a crisp wine that is ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2020 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: The wine is ripe with lime and lemon flavors. It is textured, full of fruit and with a good touch of minerality and concentration from the old vines. There is a good cut of acidity to give the wine its proper freshness. Drink from 2021.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2021 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Produced from vines in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this is an attractively cool wine. It has lively acidity and a crisp mineral texture. With its white-fruit flavors, it is a wine with weight as well as crispness. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2020 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This dense wine has a strong sense of dry tannins as well as red-berry acidity. It is balanced, in keeping with the cherry and strawberry fruits. The acidity, cutting through, keeps the wine bright and fruity. The end is strawberry jam with attractive acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2018 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This wine is fat, fruity and creamy, with just a touch of minerality. Its ripe fullness lends plenty of depth and concentration, within a lightly structured frame. Drink from 2022.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2021 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine has a crisp, steely texture. The apple and citrus flavors and the wood underlay make this a food-friendly selection.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016  Saint-Romain

description: The Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus is a 10-acre parcel in the heart of the Grèves vineyard that once belonged to Carmelite nuns. This vintage, while marked by acidity and soft fruit, does have a firm edge of dark tannins, filled out with plum and red cherry flavors.
designation: Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This dark wine is still full of young tannins from a cool, east-facing vineyard. The red-berry fruit is beginning to show through, crisp and tight with considerable acidity. The wine will take time to develop and will not be ready before 2023.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2020 En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This comes from the northern end of the line-up of Premier Crus, which shows in the lively, crisp and tightly fruity character of the wine. It is developing slowly, still controlled and with light hints of toast. It will be a beautiful, bright wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Philippe Colin 2020 Les Chaumées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This stony, mineral wine is still way behind in its development. It is crisp and tight in texture, with refreshing acidity that lifts the white fruits with lime highlights. It's a full wine that will develop well. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Cailleret Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The vineyard is high up the slope, giving this wine that has good acidity and crispness. The acidity is light and bright, while the texture is concentrated and mineral. It is going to develop as a fine, ripe wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Sous le Puits Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is full and fruity with great swathes of smoky tannins. Structured and concentrated, it promises a good future. Strawberry and red-plum flavors are there, along with the darker tannic element. Drink from 2023.
title: Albert Bichot 2020 Les Peuilletes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is one of a trio of single-vineyards bottlings from this producer. It comes from the village of Fuissé and is situated in a small valley. Elegant and perfumed, the touch of wood aging enhances the white-fruit flavor. The aftertaste is juicy while also ripe. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Fuissé 2020 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine comes from a one-acre parcel on the Corton hill. It is dense and dark both in color and in black-fruit flavors. Concentrated from the 50-year-old vines, it is firm with tannins and solid with rich fruitiness. The wine needs time; drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2020 Le Rognet  (Corton)

description: This is a big, ripe and bold wine full of red fruits and fine tannins. Crisp red currant outlines the ripe wild-strawberry flavors. It shows good balance between young tannins and the generous texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2020  Echézeaux

description: This is a smooth and rounded wine that has a fine kick of acidity to keep it crisp. With toast and lemon juice blending well together, the wine is rich while also showing a mineral texture. This is a refreshing delicious wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2020  Meursault

description: This wine comes from a steeply sloping vineyard just above the town of Nuits Saint-Georges. It is richly structured and dense with plenty of ripe fruits and acidity. The wood aging has softened the young fruitiness to give a balanced and layered wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2020 Les Crots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a ripe impressive style of Pouilly. It has all the right minerality along with a rich texture plus melon and yellow fruits. With concentration and acidity in equal measure, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2021  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Fresh, light, creamy Chardonnay, just a touch of vanilla with crisp, clean green fruits. There is an attractive touch of spice to round the wine off.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Petit Chablis

description: Tight green apple and citrus acidity dominates this wine. It is very crisp, at this stage too crisp, and the structure is on the lean side. It certainly reflects the cool growing conditions of 2011.
title: Domaine Pommier 2013 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Smooth and round, this wine has bright acidity, tempered by the toast and sweet apricot flavors. It has a structured core, and it finishes with the acidity. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine, produced in Meursault. It is fresh with lemon and tangy orange-zest flavors. A light tannic texture adds an edge to the fresh fruit.
title: Charles Duret NV Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This sparkling wine has a smooth, creamy mousse and perfumed apple and pink-grapefruit fruitiness. Light minerality gives texture, enhanced by the bright, crisp acidity and aftertaste.
title: Charles Duret NV  Crémant de Bourgogne

description: Produced from old vines grown on the property, this fruity wine is packed full of red berries. It is well balanced between fruitiness and acidity, with just a light touch of tannin to give this ready-to-drink wine its shape.
title: Château de Santenay 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: The small village of Chânes lies in the south of the appellation, well exposed to the sun. That shows in this warm wine with its ripe apple and pear flavor. Wood aging adds richness, filling out the rich fruits with toast. This generous wine will age another year. Drink from 2021.
title: Rijckaert 2020 Vers Chânes Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This vineyard is at the heart of the fine run of premier crus that lie midway up the slope above the village. This wine is packed with fruit and also with intense acidity and minerality. It is already refreshing and crisp, although as the toastiness develops, it will become even more impressive. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Les Champgains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a solid wine with its dark tannins and structure from a vineyard close to some of the greatest Grands Crus. It is concentrated, showing the density of the appellation. There is a basic richness to this wine with its ripe black fruits. It is developing slowly and has a fine future. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2020 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This wine has smoky wood and rich fruit already well in balance. It offers ripe acidity from its strawberry and red-currant fruits along with a rich texture. The wine is already delicious although it will develop much further. Drink from 2023.
title: Yves Giradin 2020 Les Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Supposedly set on an ancient burial ground, this vineyard is well placed halfway up the slope of Chassagne. It has almond and spice flavors as well as a tighter, steely texture. The wine, with its wood-aging flavors, is still developing. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2020 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Vines from a number of growers on the lower slopes of Gevrey-Chambertin contribute to this wine. It has the plentiful tannins typical of the village yet also exudes attractive juicy red fruit. It will need another year or two to show its best, so drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This wine from the most northerly of the Côte d'Or appellations is a blend from multiple growers. It has red cherry and plum fruit with a fresh streak, typical of the vintage. Underlying firm tannins will sustain it as it ages. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2020  Marsannay

description: A firm wine from a cool vineyard. It is structured, dry and solid, the fruit dominated by tannins. There is an austere character here that obviously needs time to fill out. Give it five years.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A solid wine, finely constructed, its chunky tannins blending well with the red-plum-juice flavors. The acidity is important, along with the tasty cherry texture. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine des Perdrix 2014 Aux Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: For a Grand Cru from Vosne-Romanée, this is a wine on the light side, its tannins soft and dominated by new-wood flavors. That said, it is still a fine wine, packed with ripe fruit and fresh acidity. The structure floats over the fruit; a few months and it may fatten out.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Romanée-St.-Vivant

description: Bailly Lapierre regards this full-bodied rich Pinot Noir as its signature wine. It has a cool, northern feel to it, but it also has powerful red-berry fruits, a firm structure, a final layer of acidity and a sense this is a wine as well as a Crémant.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Pinot Noir Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This lively, crisp wine comes from a less than an acre of organically grown vines. It has big lemon and green-apple flavors as well as intense acidity that gives a juicy character. With its youthful freshness, it could do with a few more months to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2020 Sur la Carrière  (Saint-Véran)

description: While it is not a premier cru, this wine conveys many of the precise red-fruit flavors of the Les Marconnets vineyard just below on the slope. It is finely perfumed, with the softness typical of the northern Beaune vineyards. Vivid strawberry and red-cherry fruits are already delicious and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2019 Clos du Dessus des Marconnets  (Beaune)

description: This is no basic white Burgundy. With balanced wood aging and ripe fruit, it is rich and full in the mouth. It has tense acidity as well as an almost honeyed character. The wood fits well into this wine along with final acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2019 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: There is as much fruit as structure in this wine. Ripe red fruits are supported by solid tannins while pushing out fragrant acidity. It has structure while also allowing room for final fruitiness.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: With rich tropical fruits and a ripe, opulent feel, this is a full-bodied wine. It has weight, layers of toast and apricot and peach flavors. Soft and round, it could be drunk now, although it would be best to wait until 2019.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2018 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine has good acidity, crisp green and white fruits, and a bright citrus element. Fresh and fruity, it's ready to drink, with a light mineral texture already well integrated.
title: La Soufrandière 2018 Climat Les Quarts  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Smooth and fruity, it's full of citrus and ripe pear fruit. Structured and quite tangy, it has potential to improve through late 2018.
title: Les Héritiers du Comte Lafon 2018 Clos de la Crochette  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: Toasty aromas go through to the palate, highlighting the wood aging. It is tense, mineral, packed with apple and lemon acidity. The aftertaste is equally crisp and bright.
title: Louis Latour 2018 Les Deux Moulins  (Saint-Véran)

description: Mango and peach aromas offer immediate attraction. With ripe fruits, light minerality and crisp acidity, it's almost ready to enjoy. Drink from the end of 2018.
title: Manoir du Capucin 2018 Clos de la Maison  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is structured, firm and has a mineral, tight texture. It also offers plenty of red apples, green plums and a touch of apricot. However, with its nervy edge the wine needs to age; drink from 2021.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2018 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This is made using a selection of fruit that's sourced from both banks of the Serein River. It's a properly crisp Chardonnay, and it offers a white fruit flavor and a bright, lively finish.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2016 Les Deux Rives  (Chablis)

description: Full and soft, this is a ripe and creamy wine, with generous melon and rich apple fruits. It is already delicious, though simple.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2015  Saint-Véran

description: Crisp, fresh sparkling wine, lightly creamy but more going towards green fruits, tight acidity. It doesn't need any bottle aging and really should be drunk in the next year to keep its essential freshness.
title: Manuel Olivier NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Open, generous wine, the fruits showing round, white peach flavors dominant, with a crispening of lemon zest.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2014 Les Grands Cheneaux  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: Bitter black cherries are the hallmark of this rather hard-edged wine. It shows dark tannins and fruit that misses full richness. Maybe it is restrained power, maybe it will age, but the balance is not there now.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The picturesque name of the wine, the vineyard where God sits, comes from a monopole—a walled property in the hills behind Beaune, wholly owned by the Château de Santenay. Ripe and smooth with an attractive, crisp texture, the wine is ready to drink. A touch of toast gives extra interest.
title: Château de Santenay 2018 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: A perfumed wine with red fruits, this offers dry tannins and a dense texture. With all these elements in place, the wine will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2021.
title: Tollot Beaut et Fils 2020 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This will be a delicious, ripe and full wine. Already the red fruits and acidity are filling out the generous space left by the spicy wood. It has dark, smoky tannins and a rich character. Drink from 2023.
title: Jaffelin 2020 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Classically powerful and rich, this is a concentrated wine. With spice from the wood aging prominent, it is still young. That spice is balanced by the ripe yellow and baked-apple fruits. The aftertaste has delicious flavors of honey and lemon. Drink this wine from 2024.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Corton-Charlemagne

description: With spice and layers of wood aging over the black-cherry fruit, this is a wine in progress. It has the bright character of the vintage, full of acidity and with the potential of great fruitiness. From the Vergennes sub-section of the Corton Grand Cru, it has a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020  Corton Vergennes

description: A level portion of this premier cru, called Les Plateaux, is the origin of this wine. As befits a wine from Nuits Saint-Georges, it is dark with tannins as well as fruit. It has a good structure, with dense blackberry and plum flavors that are developing. Give this wine until 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2020 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is wood laden, with sweet fruit that compensates for the toastiness. The oak element should integrate well in the next 2–3 years, making for a wine that's soft and sweetly fruity, with smoky acidity.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2016 Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This has a firm edge of tannins along with dense red fruits. It's structured and balanced, with the texture and acidity that suggest its aging potential. Give this 3–4 years.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2016 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Intense, rich and creamy, this effortlessly balances the wood influence with the apricot and white peach flavors. It demonstrates the opulence of the year while remaining structured. Developing well, this is almost ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2016  Montagny

description: A tight, tannic wine, showing considerable acidity as well as fresh red fruits. The wine is densely packed with dry tannins, then a fruity character develops, sparked by acidity.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2014 Les Borniques  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Crisp sparkling Burgundy, laced with taut acidity and hints of nuts and toast. This is a wine under tension, with a strong mineral element, cool and fresh, best with food.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2013  Crémant de Bourgogne

description: Pure, ripe strawberry flavors are pierced with acidity. The texture is soft, with a dry side. The raspberry acidity cuts right to the end.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Soft, ripe and rich, this is very easy on the palate. The wine does have good depth of flavor from the rounded black cherry flavors, the fruit almost sweet in its openness. It is already delicious.
title: Louis Latour 2015 En Chevret  (Volnay)

description: Concentrated, with dark tannins to go with the ripe fruit. There is a tough edge to the wine, although it is more accessible than some Nuits-Saint-Georges at this stage.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Damodes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Aromas of ripe yellow fruits announce a wine that has rich fruit flavors of apricots touched by pineapple. It does have the attractive, nervy texture of 2012, along with an important layer of toast.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A fresh, juicy wine, with attractive acidity, red berry flavors and a layer of well balanced tannins. Very perfumed, with hints of mineral and final acidity.
title: Camille Giroud 2014  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: A powerful, chunky wine, packed with solid tannins that promise good aging. It has a sense of drama in its spice, dark tannins and spacious fruit. This is going to develop well over 5–10 years.
title: Henri de Villamont 2011  Grands-Echezeaux

description: A blend from several premier cru vineyards in Pommard, here is a wine that exhibits just the right firm but dusty tannins of the appellation. But because it is 2009, the natural exuberance of the fruit is also there, lively red berries under the dry structure. It needs some aging, but already the richness is there, along with a smoky aftertaste.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Premier Cru  (Pommard)
